description:
Treasure Monsters is a turn based strategy game where you need to find all your opponent's hidden bags of treasure with pawns that you move to occupy a square on the board. Be the first to return them to your base and win the game! You need to dig through the pile of buff tiles in the middle row of the board to create a way to get to the other side. You use one of your Diggerdo pawns to turn over tiles on your opponent’s side of the game board, digging up treasure in a square. Once you successfully find all 5 bags of treasure in your opponent’s base and use your Gobbler pawn to bring them back to your base, you win the game!

—description from the designer

An abstract 1vs1 strategy game inspired by chess, roshambo (AKA RockPaperScissors), traditional italian card games and the awesome videogame 'Pawnbarian'.

Game is played on a 5x5 checkerboard and each player has 3 different pieces representing the 3 symbols of Roshambo. 
Each player also has a deck of chess cards to play.

Similar to a trump game each player has a 3 cards hand from which, in turn, they play a card. They then proceed to move one of their pieces according to the chess moving scheme represented on the card (if you play a bishop you can move any of your pieces as if it was a bishop).

Pieces are captured the same way you do in chess, but following the roshambo logic (eg: a scissor piece can only capture a paper piece).
After a player has moved he draws another card and the turn passes to his opponent.

Pieces  captured can be respawned in game using special cards and every capture is a point.

After 15 turns the game ends and the player with the highest score wins. If a player is able to capture all 3 pieces of his opponent before he is able to respawn any of them the game ends immediately by knockout.

Full rules and manual can be found on the official Scamorra site.

Instead of smashing zombies heedlessly think about collecting them and sorting them into hordes. Your goal is to build the strongest zombie army possible. You need to take some risks in order to win. Don’t be afraid to purposely mess with other players!

In Troublez players flip cards from one huge shared deck and sort zombies into three rows on the table. Every card must follow several placement rules. First, numbers can go only up and second, no two cards of the same color can be next to each other. When you successfully play a card onto the table, you can decide to stop and collect all the cards from a row of your choice, or you can push your luck and flip another card. If you cannot legally play a card, that is a bad luck and you are getting nothing!

The deck consists of zombies in three colors, but cards with special abilities can be also found there. A Net allows you to steal a zombie card from another player. With A Shotgun you can discard some zombies others are holding and if you get An Axe, you must discard a card yourself. You can be clever with your cards, since after a players turn each other player gets to grab a card from the table. Will you leave them something good? Or will you maneuver so only The Axe is waiting there?

To assemble a horde you must turn in a set of cards – four cards of the same number, or five cards of different numbers. At the end whoever has the strongest army wins.

—description from the designer

Chinese culinary delights are within reach of your shopping basket. You will need to be fast and quick-sighted in order to bring some home. Ready, steady, go!

After all the tiles have been displayed, the first player turns a card showing an ingredient.  The players have now to find the way of a single colour leading to the ingredient before the other players do.

Balancing Act is a quick playing card game where players are creating Circus Acts by playing a card from their hand and taking all the cards in the center row that are either higher valued or lower valued than that card they played. Those cards either go in their Acts creating sequential runs of cards or into their hands to be played later. Beware though you can only have so many Acts that score positive points and every card in your hand scores you negative points!

There are some special cards in the game:

     The Elephant when played allows to you play a card from your hand to one of your Acts. This is the only way you can play a card from your hand. 
     The Zebra is a wild card and worth +1 point in your Acts, but prevents you from playing cards after it.
     The Giraffe is wild as well, however it is -2 points.


The game ends when the deck of 54 cards runs out and whoever has the most points is the winner!

—description from the designer

Welcome to the real power that rules the world. Filled with ambitious members, our Secret Order all manoeuvre and connive our way to the highest echelons of humanity. By dominating the five key realms of society we impose our will upon the world.

In Secret Order you all have your own agenda. These power struggles are represented by the gathering of favour tiles. Each favour represents a weapon of manipulation to be used in the subjugation of the realms of society. Using the right power in the right market in integral to achieving your ultimate goal.

As with any behind the scenes machinations, it is unwise to reveal every tool at your disposal. Secret Order is no different. So when playing "The Game" you have tiles in the open for all to see but you also have your hidden agenda, secreted away until the time is right to strike!

Gather favour tiles, spend them to use your powers to disrupt your opponent's plans, hide them away until the time is right or collect the entire set of your desire to achieve victory and domination.

Secret Order is a fast paced game of hidden motives, power plays and ambition that will have you playing again and again.

—description from the designer

The game is a mixture between dice game and quiz game set in a German area named 'Rhön'.

The game was conceived with the idea of getting to know the natural beauty and sights of the Hessian-Bavarian-Thuringian low mountain range Rhön.

—user summary

Flip over as many serving dishes as possible to fill your monster quickly, but be careful! Mixed among the delicacies are some foods that the monsters don't like at all! You'll have to remember where they are. The first player to reach the end of the buffet and get back again wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

It's your time, now you can become the author you've always wanted and set up the group you've always dreamed of for the next COAC (Cadiz's Carnival Contest). But be careful, the rest of the authors will have their mission, to annoy you and to lead a better group than yours.

This card driven game lets you get a band together to compete in Cadiz's (Spain) most prestigious contest.

This is a filler game for anyone who wants to dare to put together a group for the next COAC. You can play from 2 to 6 players and being 7 years old is enough to be able to join the game, which will last between 15 and 30 minutes.

The Fort Jefferson Attack game is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Chickasaw attack on Fort Jefferson during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Americans and their allies, and the other player commands the Chickasaws.

Wedding bells are ringing! The successor to the most powerful family in the Kingdom is without a partner. How will you position yourself to win their favour and get a piece of the grand inheritance?

In Inheritance, each player tries to prove their legitimacy as a suitor by addressing the ever changing desires of a fickle successor and their family. Use your influence to manipulate these desires. The nature of your proposal will be of great importance, which will lead to your success? A Declaration of true love? A proclamation of peace? A generous dowry? perhaps a declaration of War!

Each turn you'll play one card from your hand that can either influence the successor's family, or change the terms of the wedding proposal. Choose carefully to ensure your selected Admirer is favoured. You win the game if you start your turn as the favoured Admirer.

—description from the publisher

SKAL! (or SKÅL!) is a Viking-themed dice-stacking dexterity-based drinking game!  Designed by Andrew Prowse, art and illustrations by Janette Ramos, graphic design by Sebastian Koziner, published by Gameland and distributed by Spiral Games and Quartermaster Logistics.

Players take on the roles of Viking gods and goddesses: Odin, Loki, Thor, Freya, Idunn and Heimdall.  Everyone collects a player mat, coloured dice and drinking cup. Each turn, the leading player turns over a card, showing an arrangement of dice then the players race to stack their own dice (plus extra from a shared pile) to match the pattern on the card.  They then grab their cups, raise them into air and call out, “SKÅL!” (Cheers in Norwegian).  Whoever does this first wins the card, which is worth 1 or 2 points, depending upon difficulty.  The first player to 9 points wins!

There are extra cards, rules, special powers and added challenges to keep the game interesting.  It can be played as a fun family game or as a rowdy adults-only drinking game if you choose. It plays really quickly (10 – 20 mins) and will be fast-paced, loud, exciting and fun!

—description from the designer

DISCLAIMER
One of our authors is Moldavian and she loves her culture and her language so much she wanted to put some of that love in our game. We can assure you that everything you see in Ahotnik is related to the fictional world we created for our game. The only place we can accept fighting and war is in a boardgame, other than that, as authors, players and human beings, we strongly reject war and violence and we firmly stand for peace and inclusivity.


In Ahotnik, the players form pairs and act as the pilots of giant robots called “Ahotniks”—each of which has its own unique designation of “OXO-##”, for this reason, they are also known as “OXOs”. Their goal is to be the first team to eliminate a rival Ahotnik. But, during their battles, otherworldly creatures referred to as “Demons” emerge from mysterious Portals and try to wreak havoc on Earth by destroying the Ahotniks. The teams must fight on both fronts if they are going to be the one to bring glory to their nation! But beware: Your thirst for power must not come at the cost of total global annihilation…

A game of Ahotnik is played over a series of rounds which are divided into 4 phases:


     Pilot Phase:
 Pilot pairs try to coordinate by using their Action tiles, which represent the cerebral commands they send to the Ahotnik. The success of their strategy depends on their level of synchrony. 
     Ahotnik Phase:
 The Ahotniks operate in this phase depending on the actions thought up by the pilots in the Pilot Phase. In order, the OXOs will carry out:
         Tactical Actions: A set of actions that can have offensive, defensive, or strategic effects.
         Movement Actions: Move the OXO on the game board.
         Attack Actions: The main (though not the only) method to damage your enemies.
    
     Demon Phase:
Beware of incoming threats! This is the turn of any Demons in play. The Radar will also indicate if any new Portals open and increase the Global Threat Level this turn.
     Recovery Phase:
Certain game elements are restored so a new round may begin. 


Rounds are repeated until an Ahotnik falls victim to another OXO or a Demon. Who will achieve total dominion of the planet?

The economic game Ð‘Ð¸Ð·Ð½ÐµÑÐ¼ÐµÐ½ ("Businessman") is one of the first advanced economic games in Russia, very similar to Monopoly.

Playing it, you get into a fascinating world of simulated financial operations, helping you better understand such matters as "Stock Exchange", "Stocks", "Bankruptcy", try your hand at fighting the competition.

Participating in this game requires the exercise of a number of qualities - mathematical abilities, the ability to quickly navigate in different situations, stimulating the development of memory, observation, and attention.

Ð‘Ð¸Ð·Ð½ÐµÑÐ¼ÐµÐ½ is a family game for all age groups starting from 8-9 years old and the number of participants from two to six people.

Features of the Game
Chibi Heroes is easy to learn but has enough depth for even experienced gamers.

The game is designed to be kid-friendly, with adorable artwork and simple, clear rules. Event cards, for example, always benefit every player but benefit the player who triggered them at least twice as much. This little tweak helps keep younger players from getting frustrated when other players trigger events.

Each player starts with two randomly determined heroes in their guild but will gain more over the course of play, so the rounds start off quick and simple but get bigger and bigger as the guilds grow.

Over the course of 6 rounds (representing 6 months of adventuring), you'll send every hero in your guild on 4 different types of missions:

Recruiting new guild-members
Collecting resources
Acquiring magical steeds
Completing Quests
With 42 different heroes, 59 Quests and 15 Events, every game is different!

On the first round there will be 7 different Quests available, with the number growing by 1 each round. On the 6th and last round, there will be 12 Quests for the guilds to fight over! Each Quest that you complete makes your guild more famous and makes recruiting new members easier.

As a Worker Placement game, you'll be competing with other players for important board locations and the most valuable Quests. There are two special locations added only in 4 and 5 player games to keep things moving smoothly.

At the end of the 6th round, the player whose guild has collected the most Fame wins the game!

Cardle is a Tech Deck game where players try to crack a hidden 6-digit code encoded in face-down Tech Deck cards administered by a codemaster. Players have seven tries to break the code. The code master selects the code and provides clues as players try to deduce the secret code.

OBJECTIVE – Players have seven tries to break a code that is selected by the code master.
THEME – The theme of the game is cryptanalysis by head-to-head code-breaking.
GAME PLAY – The game can be played in cooperative or head-to-head mode. In cooperative mode, there is one codemaster and all the other players are trying to guess the code. In head-to-head mode, two players or two teams are simultaneously trying to break the code of the other player/team. Each player/team has a Tech Deck. Each player/team serves as the codemaster for the other player/team. Players make an educated guess using their Tech Deck cards. Cards placed as a guess are called guess cards. After making a guess, the codemaster rotates the guess cards to provide information about the secret code for each of the guess cards in their positions of the code. A guess card can be an exact match, value match, displaced, or absent. 
WINNING – In cooperative mode, the players win by guessing the values of each of the positions of the secret code. In head-to-head mode, a player/team wins if they guess the exact cards (value and domain/suit) of the secret code. If after 7 turns, neither player/team has guessed the code they are awarded points based on how close to the secret code they are.

—description from the designer

Yum Cha is a cute little card game based on everyone's favourite Chinese brunch, also known as Dim Sum. The objective of this casual card game is to accumulate the most points so that you get the honour of paying the bill.

The rules are really simple to understand. Collect 3 sets of dim sums cards and 1 pair of tea cards!

10 cards are dealt to each player. All remaining cards are placed in a deck faced down. Players take turns drawing a card from either the deck or any card from the centre. The player then decides which card they want to keep and end their turn by discarding a card into the centre face-up.

Play strategically and collect small, medium, big and dessert dim sums to wrap up the game quickly, or go for glory and collect the super, special and top dim sums to score as many points as possible. You are in control of your own fortune.

A round of Yum Cha ends when a player draws the eleventh card which makes a complete hand, revealing 3 sets of dim sums and 1 pair of tea. When they do so, they announce Yum Cha! and the round ends. A set of dim sums consists of three unique dim sums from the same tier. Duplicate dim sums cannot form a part of a set. A pair of tea consists of two tea cards of the same flavour.

—description from the publisher

This is a trick-taking game comprising 40 cards: 28 pool cards, and 12 with illustrations (patterned on those of Sir John Tenniel) depicting characters including Alice, the Gryphon, the Queen of Hearts, the White Rabbit, the Hatter, the Duchess, and more. 
 Each player has 24 counters and must contribute 4 to the pool. The game involves dealing out all cards and revealing each player's top card one by one. Different characters provide different rewards and penalties relating to the pool. Revealing certain characters before others can also influence the outcome of the game.

The rule card states that the game was printed with permission of Macmillan & Co., the publisher of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.

—user summary

You are the staff working at the cat cafe.
To have to take care of things,
While trying to make customers impress.
If you take the cat to play with the customer exactly what they want, That might make them impressed and come back to our cafe again.
Let's meet the hustle and bustle of cute cats in
"Meow! The Cat Cafe"

—description from the designer

Competitive card-driven tactical combat from 2 to 4 players. Prepare to dominate and take control.

Exsilium is a fast and light game with simple rules and familiar mechanics. Players will use Deckbuilding to upgrade their decks and battle enemy factions for control the Baralytas crystals.

All players will start with 12 basic cards and draw 4 at the start of each turn. Each player can perform as many actions as there are cards in his hand and can decide between activating the action of the card or using it to move the miniatures of his faction.

Expand the territory to wherever you want. Exsilium is competitive, so ruthless and terrible tactics are welcome.

All against all, without exception.

In Exsilium you must survive both the other factions and the common enemy that has emerged from the depths of Eris. A.I. enemies allow even in two player games, the battle starts from the first second.

RULE ERIS!

Control Terminal points and upgrade your deck before the other factions. Cross the frontiers, dominate the crystals and take control of the dwarf planet.

Exsilium's mechanics allow you to place explosive mines on the ground, drop items, and use tactics to mislead A.I. enemies.

Don't forget that you have a 24-page manual where you can explore each rule in detail and make the most of your abilities in battle.

The preparation of the game is super fast and the duration for 4 players does not exceed 50 minutes.

—description from the designer

You and your fellow intrepid explorers are exploring a hot, dry desert maze. You have a limited supply of water to navigate and expose the maze path and find the way out. You will encounter quicksand, scorpions, and mirages that will fool and stymie you. Can you be the hero of the group by being the first one to expose the maze path and find the exit?

Your goal is to create a complete, unbroken maze path between the Maze Entrance and the Maze Exit and be the first Explorer to exit the maze. However, be careful not to run out of water, get caught in quicksand or encounter a scorpion!

Your maze exploration starts by shuffling all the maze tiles facedown and placing them on the table in front of you, being sure to connect at least one edge of each tile to another. You will then roll one or two dice to move over the tiles, turn them faceup, rotate them, and uncover the maze before you run out of your limited supply of water.

Along the way you will search for the hidden exit while also encountering various artifacts. Some artifacts, like the well, will help you to continue your explorations, others, like the scorpion or quicksand will not!

—description from the designer

Each player has 8 marbles of their color. They are placed on divot at the intersection between the lines.

On your turn you must move one of your marble. A marble can move as far as you want along a line. A marble cannot move through, or onto the same space as another marble. A marble that travel off the board will appear and continue traveling from the opposite side.

If you have a marble that cannot be moved at the beginning of your turn you lose the game.

—description from the designer

Survive Until Daylight is a combat-oriented survival game.  Search the rubbles to gather useful resources.  Trade and craft your items, and fight dumb yet powerful zombies for 6 challenging assaults.

It’s the apocalypse! Zombies are everywhere.  There are many sorts of them: from the weak dog walking granny to the terrible beast that no longer proves Darwin’s theory. There are also looting raiders. Bastards! And guess who was chosen to save the night? You!

Play as one of the absurd heroes available and benefit from their unique perks.  Every round, search the rubbles and gather resources to prepare for the wave to come.  When the horde hits the fan, be ready to trade and craft items. It’s your last stand before combat.  Draw and shuffle the corresponding amount of enemies to the table and start kicking some asses!

Pick the right approach and brace yourself, you will have to survive 6 different waves to save the day - well the night.

This is a two player game.
Each player has a console on which he/she can set up a 6 digit code.
The goal is to guess the other players code first. You do this using cards the game provides.

—user summary

Seven Waters | a duel of pools

Anywhere, USA just re-zoned some land, and your dream of building a water park might finally come true! Just your luck, though, that someone else has the exact same idea. Two water parks! What a world. Guess you’ll just have to build a bigger and better one. Welcome to Seven Waters!

Overview
Seven Waters is a two-player card-drafting and placement game that can be played with a traditional deck of cards (jokers included). Snag cards from a shared tableau as you attempt to create the most appealing water park, filled with four slides, a lazy river, and a wave pool!

Each turn, you may either (1) draft an available card from a shared pyramid, or (2) play a card from your hand into your water park.  Build water slides by matching the ride value to the rope line value, build a wave pool with matching suits, build a lazy river with straight runs, and theme your park by choosing a bonus value suit.  Best park wins!

—description from the designer

A mysterious roll and write, print and play game. Explore the mines, find treasures and discover the secret that lies beneath the surface.
Choose your favorite miner, gather resources, craft objects and get out of the mines in time... but beware! Dynamite is extremely dangerous and unstable.
The game includes:
Single player campaign
Multiplayer co-op
PVP
Paper clicker game mode

Single Player quick rules
GAME SETUP

     Choose the mission you want to play. It’s better to play them in order;
     Pick the game map related to the mission you chose;
     Choose your character wisely (the starting object may be crucial);
     Choose the entrance where you want to begin your adventure. Analyze carefully


the tasks that you must accomplish in order to complete the mission, it’s important to pick the best spot to start;

     The first turn begins. You have 16 turns to complete your mission and escape the mines. On the 17th turn, you lose the game. Don’t forget to mark the current spot in the progression bar placed at the bottom of the map.


TURN STRUCTURE
Movement: first, roll dice to determine the number of spots you can move. You can move in any direction, up to the number you obtained. If you roll 2 dice, you must choose one of the two results. You can use the other result to craft an object.
Action: once you’ve moved to the desired spot, check your Character Card to see the number of dice you can roll to perform actions. Both “Gathering” and “Extracting” have their own specific value that you must obtain to perform that specific action. You can use one or more dice to craft objects.
End of turn: once you’ve completed all your actions, mark the current spot of the progress bar at the bottom of the board. When you are in a “dynamite” spot, throw dice to determine where the explosion will block your way.

JinRoh, also known as JinRou (äººç‹¼), is a Japanese Mafia/Werewolf style game.

There will be 2 teams, villagers and werewolves, and a Host.  The Host, who is not on either team, is chosen to lead/moderate/narrate the game. The game alternates between Day and Night phases until the game is over.

Day Phase:
The Host calls for everyone to open their eyes and begin the first deliberations. A time limit may be established if desired. The goal is to determine The Werewolf and banish them from town. Players may “reveal” their identities and deliberate who they believe to be The Werewolf. LYING AND KEEPING SECRETS IS OKAY. The Host will call for all players to point at whom they want to banish. The player with the most votes is banished from the city and can no longer participate in discussions or nightly actions.
 Night Phase:
The Host calls for everyone to close their eyes. The Host calls one role at a time to perform their nightly action. The order proceeds as follows “Bodyguard, open your eyes and point at the person you would like to protect. Okay. Close your eyes.” “Werewolf, open your eyes and point at the person you would like to kill. Okay. Close your eyes.” (If there is more than one Werewolf, they will silently come to an agreement on ONE victim.) “Prophet, open your eyes and point at one person to see their identity. (The Host will gesture to indicate if that person is human or werewolf) Okay. Close your eyes.” “Necromancer, open your eyes. You may see the identity of the person who was last banished. (The Host will gesture to indicate if that person was human or werewolf). Okay. Close your eyes.”
Unless they are protected by The Bodyguard, the Werewolf’s victim is killed and removed from the game.
 The Human Team wins when all Werewolves are banished from the town. The Werewolf Team wins when the number of remaining Humans is reduced to the number of remaining Werewolves.

Towards the end of the XIV Century, King D. João I ordered the construction of one of the most elegant Portuguese monasteries, the Monastery of Santa Maria da Vitória. During the construction period numerous prestigious architects, master craftsmen, and apprentices came from all over Europe motivated by financial rewards, prestige, and, importantly, the pursuit of knowledge.

In Moesteiro, players are architects in charge of teams of workers and master artisans and they compete for the glory of becoming the most prolific and important architect of their time.

The game is played over five rounds. Once all dice have been placed players will perform actions in the order of the action areas, from I to V. After that each player will have an opportunity to help build the monastery. During the game Victory Points (VPs) can be earned from the King tiles, from the village and in helping to construct the monastery. At the end of the game VPs are earned for sets of different unused stonework and stained glass tiles, as well as for their position on the labour track. The winner is the player with most VPs.

-description from designer

Encounters: Shattered Wastes is a cooperative board game. Each player chooses one or more characters (for a total of 2-4 characters being used in a single game) to explore the land of untamed magic known as The Shattered Wastes.

Players will fight an enemy in a battle known as an Encounter. Players win an encounter when both sides of an Enemy Card are defeated by reducing the enemy’s Strength and inflicting Wounds. Players and their characters will need to work together to weaken the enemy using their own attacks, which shifts the enemy’s Strength from Stamina to Fatigue. This will Stagger the enemy, giving players the opportunity to inflict Wounds upon it. Enemies will harm characters by using both Strength and Rage cards.

Players lose an encounter if all characters have been removed from the Encounter by having their Health Points (HP) reduced to 0 or have fully succumbed to corruption.

—description from the designer

SANDANNOTOU is a trick-taking game for exactly 3 players.

The game includes a board showing most of the ranks of the cards around the border of an octagonal board, and lines connecting each of the values. During setup, players draft placing towers onto spaces created by the intersecting lines or on a person sheet.

The cards played to a trick will generally form a triangle on the board.  Any towers within a trick's triangle gain a token if the owner followed suit and loses one if they did not.

After all cards have been played, the game ends.  Each token on a tower is worth 1 point, unless the tower has 4 token; towers with 4 tokens are worth no points.  The player with the most points wins.

Confront your rival guild in a race for victory. Take Gem and Pearl tokens from the common board, then purchase cards, gather bonuses, royal favors, and prestige.

Discover new twists and strategic opportunities derived from Splendor, the original best-selling game. Acquire cards with impressive powers, take advantage of special Privileges, and fight over scarce access to Pearls.

Splendor Duel is a two-player only standalone game based on Splendor that retains some of the main gameplay mechanisms of that design, while being a bit more complex, dynamic, interactive, rich, tense, and mean.

The game features a main board shared by both opponents, card powers, and three victory conditions.

O'Tali's Bizaare is a culmination of shops, inn's, gambling dens, hired guns, and more! The vendors in O'Tali's Bizzare either thrive in the chaotic ebb and flow of the bizarre or owe the Merchant's Guild a debt. These same vendors often travel outside the safety of the bizarre to find rare resources, priceless artifacts, or slay great beasts to make unique items sell in their shops. The market is competitive, and vendors must do whatever it takes to stay in demand.

Gameplay:

O'Tali's Bizaare is a engine building RPG were players try to gain the most from their sales, over a limited set of rounds. The day/night cycle gives players a wide array of actions to take and ways to win.

—description from the designer

Classical Hangman Game with 160 words. There is a paper with two possible words. The player(s) choose 1 or 2 and the game master player for this round split of part with the words. Now the player(s) can for example choose an „e“ and the game master can tell them that it is on 1,3,6. It’s easy because under every letter is a short number so you can directly say the position. Quick good vacation game.

Based on the classic British sci-fi television series, Thunderbirds: Danger Zone is a fast-paced cooperative family card game.

Send the International Rescue Team out into the Danger Zone on daring rescues and bring them home safely to Tracy Island. Players collaborate to bring fuel, weapons, knowledge and team spirit efficiently into the game under the expert guidance of Jeff Tracy.

Using characters and missions from the original TV series, players work as a team to avert disasters worldwide and beyond. Players take turns as Jeff, deciding what resource needs to be deployed and where. Players might use their cards to help get the right amount of fuel Scott needs for a rescue or to deliver the tools and gadgets needed by Lady Penelope to chase The Hood. Only Jeff can make the changes needed to ensure success. Every moment counts and if the numbers don't add up vital time will be lost. Can you work as a member of the International Rescue Team, save those in peril and bring everyone home safely?

Components: 110 cards, 90 tokens, game rules
Box size: 180 x 130 x 40 mm

—description from the publisher

Two armies march to the relief of the fortress and its exhausted garrison. One from the East, and one from the North, converging on the outnumbered enemy. That enemy was the Army of Italy, the first field command of Napoleon Bonaparte. The fifteen days that followed would make him a legend.

Taking as its subject Bonaparte's famous Arcole campaign, Siege of Mantua is a game of operational maneuver and tactical daring. Players move blocks on the mapsheet to threaten and deceive their opponent, with the object of bringing them to a decisive battle. These are fought on a battle display with counters drawn randomly from your unit pool. The quality of your pool improves with every victory; suffering losses will damage morale, degrading unit quality.

You must master both of these spheres if you wish to be victorious. Though outnumbered, the French player has the benefit of moving along interior lines, allowing greater coordination of forces. But those men are stretched thin to deal with two distinct lines of enemy advance. The Austrian player can use this to their advantage, bringing superior forces to bear at weak points in the enemy line. What results is a desperate battle of wits and nerve, and a novel take on the "block game" genre.

-description from publisher

Spell Out! is an all-new word game from Next Dimension Games.  Wordplay challenges meet area-control gameplay as 1-4 players race to claim words on the board before their opponents, blocking other players' moves on the way and claiming bonuses wherever possible.  Choose your words wisely - the game depends on it!

Play starts by revealing a challenge card, for example 'words with the blend CK' and each come up with a 5-letter word that fits, e.g. cloCK.  Players then take it in turns to move their pieces on the board, aiming to line them up with all the letters in their word and declare "Spell Out!" before their opponents can do the same.

Letters on the outer ring win you a bonus token if you can get them into a word, and you can exchange it later for an extra turn, but beware! Spent tokens are claimed by opponents, potentially handing them a very useful extra move!

With bounce spaces for advanced movement strategies, randomised start positions and two difficulty levels of cards, Spell Out is the always-fresh word game for families and groups of all ages, skilful wordsmiths and seasoned gamers alike.

Spell Out also includes a Solo Challenge Mode and multiple optional play variants.

-description from designer

The beetles that live in flower meadows are in great danger. A hungry bird could fly by at any moment and, if it spots them, it could eat them. But the beetles have learned how to become almost invisible in the grass. Help them hide too!

A fun development board game that's great fun for younger children, so the whole family can play together.

The aim of the game is for each player to collect and hide 4 beetles under the grass. Since the beetles are different sizes, the plants that hide them are also different sizes. The ladybird can be hidden by the smallest grass, while the potato beetle can be hidden by the medium size and the deer beetle by the largest.

Battle Of The Breweries Season 1 Card Game is a fast paced and strategic game, that pits rival breweries against each other.

The worlds first Trading Card game featuring real world breweries and beers.
130 breweries are a part of Season 1 from 30 countries!

Take control of a world renowned brewery as a brand new co-owner!
Your first task? Build the greatest taproom in the world for your fans to flock to.
Along the way, you'll have to source beers within your fans favourite ABV% range, stock beers that are linked to your brewery, find the glassware that compliments your beers and locate your breweries Pet or Mascot.
It all sounds too easy, but your rivals have decided to copy your plans. You won't know who they are or what they're trying to source themselves, and you'll have to defend yourself from thieves and attackers that are out to steal your items.

It's time to fight your way to glory and become the greatest brewery in the world!


    Includes the Trading Cards of 15 breweries inside, along with everything you need to take on your rival breweries in a strategic, fast paced and exciting game.


—description from the designer

Terra Nova is a simplified version of the strategy game Terra Mystica. In the game, up to four players each control one of ten factions, each with different abilities. Compete against one another to explore new territories in peaceful competition, erect buildings, and achieve certain goals from round to round. Use your faction's special abilities in a clever way to control the largest territory at game's end and finish with the most points.

A game for children who are called to recognize sounds that are being played to them by the provided two CDs. They are then marked by token on boards and on the end the one who has identified the most sounds correctly wins!

—user summary

Math learning game with plastic number pieces and plastic board with basic math calculations, with holes to fit the right numbers.

At the start of the game plastic pieces are randomly distributed evenly to the players. Player with the number one piece starts the game by putting it to it's place in the leftmost space in uppermost line. After that player who has the next correct piece places it to the next open space. If you can fill the last space in the line, then you can give every other player one of your pieces. The player who'll first get rid of all of their pieces is the winner.

—user summary

Typical roll and move game about the post delivering history around the world (from Europe, Asia, North America, Africa).
The first player, who cross the route with 41 stops first, wins the game.

—user summary

On a school trip you visit a castle. As soon as you enter, all the doors close and you are trapped in the castle. Now you have to find the exit together.

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

The legendary secrets of the breathtaking metropolis of London are finally to be uncovered. For this, you are needed as an investigator! Explore every corner of the mysterious city and solve the numerous tricky puzzles and secrets you encounter along the way. Only in this way will there be an escape at the end to pass the exciting adventure.

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

Military strategy game based on aerial bombing raids. One of many propaganda-based wargames published in Nazi Germany before WWII.

The board is on heavy cardstock and depicts various terrain features with a superimposed grid for movement of units.

The game comes with 28 toy figures made of tin: 20 aircraft (6 twin-engine bombers and 4 fighters for each player) and 8 anti-aircraft guns (4 for each player). There are also 12 round paper counters (6 for each player). Each unit has a value on the bottom to represent the impact of capture.

—user summary

Players will be a politician and they will be gerrymandering the board. The player with the most district wins.
This turn-based game introduces the concept of gerrymandering in the most relevant way. These days, the game is highly sensitive, and there is a need to educate more people about the repercussions of democracy

The players will start with some cash to purchase the corruption cards to change and manipulate the voters on the board. Once the players finish their money in the campaign phase, they will start the gerrymander phase with the district pieces they purchase in the campaign phase.

—description from the designer

Cattivik and the rats have to go through the maze of the sewers in search of a loot, made up of different objects. But our characters get in the way of each other and the labyrinth changes its appearance at every turn and so it is not easy to find everything, get rid of the bad luck and return to the starting point: whoever succeeds first wins!

Three boxes for three stories await you: work in a team and ask the right questions - the answers may surprise you.

The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori is part of a trilogy: three investigating games that will keep you nailed to the table with bated breath!

Try to shed light on a mysterious event, collecting valuable clues between places to explore carefully, objects to analyze, and pressing interrogations. At the end of the investigation, you will be asked some questions that will measure how able you have been in solving the mystery, getting points for each correct answer. Each investigation is divided into several chapters that will allow you to continue the investigation. The detective's work seems to never end, and one case leads to another: if you feel able to answer the final questions, turn the card!

In The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori, (Crime under the spotlights), a famous actor dies on the set of his last film because of a real bullet, loaded into a gun that had to shoot blanks, while shooting the last scene. How did this happen? In the show business nothing is as it seems and everyone has something to hide.

—description from the publisher

As thieves in search of loot, you and your partner stand in front of a mansion and rub your hands. Heaps of money are said to be behind these walls, money that you would only love to steal — even though both of you are anything but professional thieves. You want to try your luck, but the rooms are equipped with numerous lasers that must be avoided, and you must work quickly before time runs out...

In the co-operative game Complices, players have two minutes to steal as many coins as possible without hitting the security lasers present in the room. To do this, each player puts on glasses with a red or blue color filter that prevents them from seeing one of the types of lasers. The player with the red glasses must then trace a path in the room with the marker in order to recover the coins and treasures, while the player with the blue glasses is their guide. Communicate as well as possible to avoid obstacles! Each coin recovered is worth 1 point, while each laser hit causes you to lose 1 point. If you collect enough coins to fill your hideout after four rounds, you win the game.

Complices contains sixteen rooms in four levels of difficulty, with new laser shapes and new mechanisms for each level.

In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and  along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues. 
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In 'Mini Crimes: Omicidio a sangue freddo' ("Mini Crimes: Homicide in cold blood"), take a trip through time in 1948 and investigate the mysterious death of James Stein, Curator of Snakes at the Zoological Society of London, who died under very suspicious circumstances.

—description from the publisher
